displayName.text: East Side Auto Auto Service Experts

formattedAddress: 1867-1877 Park Ave, New York, NY 10035, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1867-1877 Park Ave, New York, NY 10035, USA

originalText.text: Was there for my annual inspection. Nice folks... very fast, And thorough inspection service. I will definitely go back to them for service.

text.text: Was there for my annual inspection. Nice folks... very fast, And thorough inspection service. I will definitely go back to them for service.

originalText.text:
They’re very nice and informative. Everything was digital so I was able to get updates on my car via text with pictures and full descriptions. I was also able to choose which service I wanted to get started on first and reschedule for the ones I wanted later. It was an absolute pleasure. They were pretty busy, but definitely was able to get my car looked at before they closed for the day! Definitely recommend this place 10/10!!

Thank you for all the help and information you guys!

text.text:

They were pretty busy, but definitely was able to get my car looked at before they closed for the day! Definitely recommend this place 10/10!!

Thank you for all the help and information you guys!

originalText.text: I’ve taken my Range Rover here since I bought it new for oil changes, radiator repair, inspections, etc.  They always take great care of me with friendly faces and reasonable prices.  Can’t say enough great things about them.

text.text: I’ve taken my Range Rover here since I bought it new for oil changes, radiator repair, inspections, etc.  They always take great care of me with friendly faces and reasonable prices.  Can’t say enough great things about them.

originalText.text: Beware!!! They almost trashed my car! I am a car enthusiast who went through BMW technician training. I DIY this car from A to Z in my own shop. I came on a tow truck with a dead starter motor 100 miles from home. The owner proudly told me that they were professionals and would do a repair to the specs. They charged double for labor and parts and unnecessary diagnostic. After several months the BMW E90 high-pressure fuel pump started to die, and I started a DIY to replace it. The disassembly is 90% like for the starter motor. Here is what I found. 1) The strut tower braces were installed wrongly, mixed up. 2) They lost a top engine wire cover. 3) Almost all wire harness holders, even the rubber ones, were broken. 4) The intake manifold was extremely overtightened. 5) They bolted the main (red) cable to the starter, severely damaging the insulation. The wire was exposed. And it could DESTROY all of the electronics or cause a FIRE. 6) I found a plastic clip holder IN THE INTAKE OF THE 6th CYLINDER. I am lucky that it was too big to enter the cylinder bore. Otherwise, my engine would be TRASHED. This part is from a different location of the engine. 7) They used old bolts for the starter motor, which were already loose. This is one time bolts that lock only once and must be replaced after each disassembly. 8) They overtightened the bolts on the air filter broking the threads. 9) They broke a plastic clip and destroyed a thread on the intake duct (this part cost $160).

I am lucky that it was too big to enter the cylinder bore. Otherwise, my engine would be TRASHED. This part is from a different location of the engine. 7) They used old bolts for the starter motor, which were already loose. This is one time bolts that lock only once and must be replaced after each disassembly. 8) They overtightened the bolts on the air filter broking the threads. 9) They broke a plastic clip and destroyed a thread on the intake duct (this part cost $160).

originalText.text: Had a tire leak on Sunday. Courteous, efficient, reliable. Had new tire in two days. Also auto inspection. No waiting. Recommend this company.

text.text: Had a tire leak on Sunday. Courteous, efficient, reliable. Had new tire in two days. Also auto inspection. No waiting. Recommend this company.
